qas.question: What new agency did Bush create after 9/11?
What other massive agency's creation was the DHS compared to?
What did the DHS focus on?

answers.text: domestic efforts to prevent future attacks

qas.question: What did the Bush administration do instead of military efforts?

plausible_answers.text: United States Department of Homeland Security

qas.question: What Bush agency was created before 9/11?
When were the armed forces consolidated?
What was consolidated into the Department of Homeland Security?
Which administration created the Department of Defense?

context: In addition to military efforts abroad, in the aftermath of 9/11 the <b8_0>Bush<b8_0/> Administration <b4_0>increased <a3_0>domestic efforts<b4_0/> to prevent future attacks<a3_0/>. Various government bureaucracies that handled security and military functions were reorganized. A new cabinet-level agency called the <b5_0>United States <a0_0>Department of Homeland Security<b5_0/><a0_0/> was created in <a1_0><b6_0>November 2002<b6_0/><a1_0/> to lead and coordinate the largest reorganization of the U.S. federal government since the consolidation of <b7_0>the armed forces<b7_0/> into <a2_0>the Department of Defense<a2_0/>.[citation needed]
